result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

09:41 AM Defendant Timothy J Waite in court with attorney Sarvan Singh.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defense.
The Defendant requests a prelim hearing.
The Court conducts a hearing:

Officer James Miller, of the Muskego Police Department, sworn in and testifies on direct by ADA Hirt.
Cross examination by attorney Singh.
The witness is excused and the State rests.
The Defense rests with no testimony proffered.
ADA Hirt moves to admit State's exhibit #1.  No objection from attorney Singh. The Court recieves State's exhibit #1. 
The Court deems testimony closed.

The State moves for bind over.
The Defense objects to bind over.
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle during the pendency of the case. Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.   CAM duration pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM. Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.
